item.title: Matthew Hussey shares secrets to finding love in new book
item.description: Best-selling author and dating coach Matthew Hussey, known for his popular podcast "Love Life with Matthew Hussey" and his popular YouTube videos, unveils his new book "Love Life: How to Raise Your Standards, Find Your Person, and Live Happily -- No Matter What."

item.title: April Simpkins publishes daughter Cheslie Kryst's posthumous book "By the Time You Read This"
item.description: Former Miss USA and Extra correspondent Cheslie Kryst shared her excitement about writing her first book, finishing the manuscript shortly before she died by suicide in 2022, at age 30. Her family says she battled severe depression for years. Now, her mother, April Simpkins, is honoring her daughter's wish by publishing her book. It's called "By the Time You Read This: The Space Between Cheslie's Smile and Mental Illness." April Simpkins joins us first on "CBS Mornings." For more information on Cheslie Kryst go to cheslieckrystfoundation.org

item.title: Eric Church talks new Nashville bar and residency
item.description: Country music star Eric Church has had a standout year, marked by the opening of his new bar, restaurant and venue called "Chief's" in Nashville. In addition to launching this highly-anticipated spot, Church is playing a 19-show residency there.

item.title: Chanel Miller talks finding joy with new children's book "Magnolia Wu Unfolds It All"
item.description: Chanel Miller, celebrated for her profound memoir "Know My Name," steps into a new creative realm with her children's book "Magnolia Wu Unfolds It All." The story, both written and illustrated by Miller, follows two young friends on an adventurous quest through New York City to return misplaced socks from Magnolia's parents' laundromat.

item.title: Bebe Neuwirth returns to Broadway in "Cabaret" revival
item.description: Emmy and Tony Award-winning actress Bebe Neuwirth is back on Broadway, starring as Fraulein Schneider in the new revival of "Cabaret."

item.title: Angel Carter Conrad reveals new posthumous music from Aaron Carter
item.description: First on "CBS Mornings," we're getting a first listen to a never-before-heard song from Aaron Carter. Carter died in 2022 after struggling with addiction and mental health issues. Now, his team and his sister, Angel Carter Conrad, are releasing his previously unheard music. "The Recovery Album" comes out May 24. Part of the proceeds will go to the nonprofit "The Kids Mental Health Foundation," formerly known as "On Our Sleeves."

item.title: The top 5 moments from Coachella 2024
item.description: Surprise guests, a broken foot and a history-making headliner.

item.title: Eric Church transforms hardship into harmony at new Nashville hotspot
item.description: Eric Church is revered as one of country music's most respected figures, often described as Nashville's renegade. But he admits that even after his success, he sometimes still sees himself as an outsider.

item.title: Aaron Carter's previously unheard music to help kids mental health nonprofit
item.description: Angel Carter Conrad talks about her brother Aaron Carter, his death and how she hopes his legacy and previously unheard music can help others.

item.title: PEN America calls off awards ceremony amid criticism over response to Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Facing widespread unhappiness over its response to the Israel-Hamas war, the writers' group PEN America has called off its annual awards ceremony.

item.title: Spice Girls reunite at Victoria Beckham's birthday party
item.description: The Spice Girls had a reunion on Saturday and even put on an impromptu performance.

item.title: Rock Roll Hall of Fame's latest class includes Mary J. Blige and Cher
item.description: Mary J. Blige, Cher, Foreigner, A Tribe Called Quest, Kool The Gang, Ozzy Osbourne, Dave Matthews Band and Peter Frampton have been named to the Rock Roll Hall of Fame.

item.title: Julie Andrews on finding her voice again, as a children's book author
item.description: The singer and actress began a new career when she teamed with daughter Emma Walton Hamilton to write a hugely successful series of children's books. Their 35th, "Waiting in the Wings," about a troupe of theatrical ducks, is based on a true story.

item.title: Julie Andrews and Emma Walton Hamilton, mother-daughter writing team
item.description: Singer and actress Julie Andrews began a new career when she teamed with daughter Emma Walton Hamilton to write a hugely successful series of children's books. Their 35th, "Waiting in the Wings," about a troupe of theatrical ducks, is based on a true story. "Sunday Morning" anchor Jane Pauley talks with Andrews and Hamilton about a remarkable mother-daughter collaboration.

item.title: Passage: In memoriam
item.description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the notable figures who recently left us, including singer-songwriter and guitarist Dickey Betts, of The Allman Brothers.

item.title: Willkommen, Bienvenue, Welcome: "Cabaret" returns to Broadway
item.description: The classic musical, which first opened in 1966, is back on Broadway in an immersive new production titled "Cabaret at the Kit Kat Club," starring Eddie Redmayne, Gayle Rankin and Bebe Neuwirth. Leave your troubles outside!

item.title: Eddie Redmayne, Gayle Rankin on the return of "Cabaret" to Broadway
item.description: "Sunday Morning" looks at the enduring popularity of the John Kander/Fred Ebb musical "Cabaret," from its debut in 1966 and the Oscar-winning Bob Fosse film, to the latest revival on Broadway, in a production titled "Cabaret at the Kit Kat Club." Correspondent Mo Rocca talks with actors Eddie Redmayne (who plays the Emcee), Gayle Rankin (Sally Bowles) and Bebe Neuwirth (Fraulein Schneider), and with designer Tom Scutt, about their goal of immersing the audience in the story.

item.title: "The Covenant of Water" author Abraham Verghese
item.description: He teaches medical students about the importance of bedside manner, but he has another calling, as author of the New York Times bestselling novel "The Covenant of Water," a multi-generational tale of a family in India experiencing love and tragedy.

item.title: "The Covenant of Water" author Abraham Verghese
item.description: Dr. Abraham Verghese teaches medical students about the importance of bedside manner at Stanford University's School of Medicine. But he has another calling, as author of the New York Times bestselling novel "The Covenant of Water," a multi-generational tale of a family in India experiencing love and tragedy. Verghese talks with correspondent Tracy Smith about uprooting his family to take a writing program at the University of Iowa in order to pursue his dream of being a writer; and about receiving the news that his latest novel would be an Oprah's Book Club pick.

item.title: Full interview: Catching up with Phish ahead of four night residency at Las Vegas's Sphere
item.description: Phish is famous for their otherworldly performances. They're putting on 4 sold-out shows at Las Vegas' Sphere, where the show can become a fully immersive experience for the audience. Phish guitarist Trey Anastasio spoke to CBS's Kris Van Cleave about preparing for the unique shows and what the band's unlikely path to success has looked like.

item.title: Catching up with Phish at Las Vegas' Sphere
item.description: Phish is famous for their otherworldly performances. They're putting on 4 sold-out shows at Las Vegas' Sphere, where the show can become a fully immersive experience for the audience. Kris Van Cleave got to see how the band is preparing for this big stage.

item.title: Taylor Swift inspired college courses aim to give students a peek at her business prowess
item.description: At UC Berkeley, two student teachers, Sofia Lendahl and Miaad Bushala, lead a class called "Artistry and Entrepreneurship: Taylor's Version." More than a dozen top universities are offering Taylor Swift inspired courses.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Daniel Donato's Cosmic Country performs "Rose in a Garden"
item.description: Singer-songwriter Daniel Donato began his music journey after being inspired by popular video game "Guitar Hero." After busking in the streets of Nashville, Donato landed a gig with a house band, and eventually began his own band. From his album "Reflector," here is Daniel Donato's Cosmic Country with "Rose in a Garden."

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Daniel Donato's Cosmic Country performs "Weathervane"
item.description: Singer-songwriter Daniel Donato began his music journey after being inspired by popular video game "Guitar Hero." After busking in the streets of Nashville, Donato landed a gig with a house band, and eventually began his own band. From his album "Reflector," here is Daniel Donato's Cosmic Country with "Weathervane."

item.title: Actor Rory Scovel on his long career and new comedy special
item.description: You may know Rory Scovel from his TV and film roles, but the actor's artistic vision is also visible on canvas and in his new comedy special on Max. Dana Jacobson sits down with the actor to discuss his life and career.

item.title: Saturday Sessions: Daniel Donato's Cosmic Country performs "Lose Your Mind"
item.description: Singer-songwriter Daniel Donato began his music journey after being inspired by popular video game "Guitar Hero." After busking in the streets of Nashville, Donato landed a gig with a house band, and eventually began his own band. From his album "Reflector," here is Daniel Donato's Cosmic Country with "Lose Your Mind."

item.title: Book excerpt: "The Covenant of Water" by Abraham Verghese
item.description: The multi-generational tale of a family in India experiencing love and tragedy was a New York Times bestseller, and an Oprah's Book Club pick.

item.title: Swift breaks Spotify records for most-streamed album, artist in a single day
item.description: Taylor Swift broke her own records, Spotify said, and now owns the record for the top three most-streamed albums in a single day.

item.title: Swiftie couple recreates Taylor Swift album covers
item.description: Charlie Bird — the "major Swiftie" of the two — had the idea after the singer announced her new album "The Tortured Poets Department" at the Grammys.
